Line1: From fairest creatures we desire increase
Line2: That thereby beauty's rose might never die
Line3: But as the riper should by time decease
Line4: His tender heir might bear his memory

Line1: When forty winters shall besiege thy brow
Line2: And dig deep trenches in thy beauty's field
Line3: Thy youth's proud livery so gazed on now
Line4: Will be a totter'd weed of small worth held

Line1: Look in thy glass and tell the face thou viewest
Line2: Now is the time that face should form another
Line3: Whose fresh repair if now thou not renewest
Upon thy self thy beauty's legacy?
column6: And being frank she lends to those are free
